p: Each year, seasonal influenza epidemics cause an estimated 3 to 5 million severe illnesses and 290,000 to 650,000 deaths worldwide [ 1, 2]. Young children, older adults, pregnant women, immunocompromised individuals, and patients of any age with cardiopulmonary conditions or other chronic diseases are considered to have the highest risk of severe influenza illness [ 3, 4]. Hospitalization and death due to influenza, however, can also occur in individuals who were previously healthy [ 5].
